BONHAM ISD TO CLOSE NOLAN ASHMORE DURING SCHOOL HOURS
The Bonham ISD will begin closing Nolan Ashmore Drive during the day beginning August 20th. Gates have been set in place and will be locked Monday-Friday from 6:30 a.m. until 6 p.m.

There is a high volume of student traffic walking from the high school to the fieldhouses and stadium. For example, during the fall this includes football players, the band, drill team, cheerleaders, and P.E. students. Closing the road will allow them to move safely between sites. Off-season football, soccer, and track athletes go to the stadium in the winter and spring.

Gates will be open on football game nights, weekends, and holidays. Parents may pick up student-athletes from the Finley-Oates parking lot east of the stadium after practices. Student pick-up for the high school is from the circle drive in front of the campus.

The Fall Creek School District was named an Innovative District in 2016 and 2017 by the International Center for Leadership in Education. Joe has held the positions of a Kindergarten, 2nd-Grade, and 5th-grade teacher. Joe also has been a counselor and high school coach prior to becoming an elementary principal. In 2011, Joe became a Superintendent and in 2019 he was named National Superintendent of the Year by Education Drive!

Thank you again Dr. Sanfelippo for sharing your time with us!

Next Steps for the Warrior Family - March 16, 2020

What an unbelievable couple of days! I shared with my staff this morning how we are navigating uncharted territory. I emphasized that as long as every decision is made with the students in our hearts, we can't go wrong!

We made the decision to close this week to give us time. We didn't (and don't) think this week is all that is necessary to help 'flatten the curve' of COVID-19; rather we needed a few days to help make a more informed decision - and do it quickly enough to give you all a heads up that closure was coming. As closure announcements have begun around our state, you are beginning to see districts announce they are closing for 1, 2 - even 3 weeks. I don't know anything definitive at this time, except that there is a very real possibility that we have a long road ahead of us. I plan to make a decision about operations for at least the week of March 23-27 by the middle of this week in order that families can prepare.

#It'sStillAGreatDayToBeAWarrior

Sincerely,
Kelly Trompler
Bonham ISD Superintendent

Bonham ISD had decided to remain closed from March 16 - 20 in an attempt to minimize the health and safety risks to our community from the coronavirus. Please know that students are always at the heart of our decisions, and we are managing this situation with them and our entire community in mind.
